c74object.name: randomvals~
c74object.digest: High quality random values at audio rate
c74object.description: randomvals~ and its message rate counterpart (randomvals) generate high-quality pseudorandom numbers of a flat or gaussian-based distribution between 0 and 1. randomvals~ requires triggering to cause output in order to conserve CPU (it is intended for sample-accurate control, rather than noise generation). The gaussian mode allows for the combination of multiple curves, each with its own parameters for mean (between 0 and 1), deviation and weight. More distributions may be added at a later stage.

method.name: signal
method.description:
A signal below 1 will give an output of 0.
A signal of 1 to 2 will give a flat distribution of values between 0 and 1.
A signal of higher than 2 will give a multiple windowed gaussian distribution of values between 0 and 1.

method.name: list
method.description:
A list of three values can be sent into randomvals~ via a message to set a windowed gaussian distribution. The list must be formatted in the order:
mean / deviation / weight.
Multiple windowed gaussian distributions can be set by a single message by providing more sets of three values.

entry.name: signal
entry.description: Outputs a high quality random values as an audio rate signal in the range of 0. to 1.
